newsArray.title: Erik ten Hag concerned by Manchester United‚Äôs mounting injury problems
newsArray.description: The Red Devils have lost Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Harry Maguire since the weekend.
newsArray.content: This has been a challenging start to the season for the Old Trafford giants, with off-field issues compounded by a run of three defeats in their last four Premier League matches. United‚Äôs 3-1 meek home loss to Brighton is hardly the best preparation to face Bundesliga champions Bayern Munich on Wednesday, nor are the injury problems that continue to pile up. The Red Devils have lost Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Harry Maguire since the weekend, joining the likes of Raphael Varane, Mason Mount, Luke Shaw and Tyrell Malacia on the sidelines. ‚ÄúYes, of course it‚Äôs a concern,‚Äù Ten Hag said of the spate of injuries that leaves him with a 21-man squad in Germany featuring four goalkeepers. ‚ÄúBut we knew that before and that‚Äôs why we constructed the squad with depth, so we can deal with it, the squad can deal with it.‚Äù Asked whether he can speak to the medical staff about the injury situation, the United boss said: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if we have to go to the doctors or physios because they are dealing with the problems. ‚ÄúFirst of all, injuries always come in top football because we‚Äôre living on the edge. ‚ÄúOf course we analyse why things happen, but we also have to deal with the facts and it‚Äôs always about the players available. Testing out the new ball üëå ‚Äî Manchester United (@ManUtd) ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a strong side we can line up and we have to get the best out of it and we‚Äôre focusing on that. ‚ÄúTo bring up tomorrow again, a good team, make the next step, integrate Rasmus Hojlund, (Sergio) Reguilon), two new players and we are here to get a result.‚Äù Sofyan Amrabat, Kobbie Mainoo and Amad Diallo are others out of the Group A opener through injury, while Donny van de Beek is unavailable having been left out of United‚Äôs Champions League squad. Beyond that, Jadon Sancho remains absent ‚Äúpending resolution of a squad discipline issue‚Äù and Antony has been given a leave of absence following assault allegations against him. ‚ÄúOne thing is true, I think from the start last season I think I almost never started with the best starting XI ‚Äì there was always something like injury,‚Äù Ten Hag said. ‚ÄúBut you have to deal with it and I think we always got the results in apart from the period where we are in now. ‚ÄúThat is football and I have the experience in the past, I managed it in the past. It‚Äôs not always going up and you have to deal with it. ‚ÄúI like these situations because now we have to handle it and we have to manage this. You have to know what to do and that is focusing on the process.‚Äù Ten Hag‚Äôs belief about their path is why he is not getting thrown off kilter by the negativity heading into United‚Äôs first Champions League match in 18 months. ‚ÄúNo, we don‚Äôt feel that we need a reset,‚Äù the former Bayern Munich reserve boss said. ‚ÄúAbsolutely not. ‚ÄúWe are in a process and what you see is that in parts of games we play very good but then also in parts of games we played below our levels. ‚ÄúWhat we have to demand is be consistent, so we have to step up in certain levels all the time for 90-plus minutes. That is the demand on us.‚Äù Wednesday certainly looks a tough ask for United, who will face England captain Harry Kane after he joined Bayern following a summer of speculation. Champions League‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs go! ‚Äî Harry Kane (@HKane) United were strongly linked with the 30-year-old but plumped for promise rather than a proven goalscorer by signing Hojlund, 10 years his junior, from Atalanta. ‚ÄúI think we discussed (Kane and Hojlund during pre-season), so I don‚Äôt think we have to repeat this debate,‚Äù Ten Hag said. ‚ÄúWe are happy with Rasmus. Obviously first games he was injured, he played now Arsenal, he‚Äôs now started. ‚ÄúNow of course we have to integrate him in a team but you can see he‚Äôs a big talent and he will contribute to our game. We are quite confident of that.‚Äù Asked if he had regrets about not signing Kane, Ten Hag simply responded: ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

Rafael Leao guilty of bad miss as Newcastle earn point in UCL opener at AC Milan
newsArray.description: Keeper Nick Pope had to be at his best to keep the Rossoneri at bay before the break.
newsArray.content: The Portugal international, who was Newcastle star Sandro Tonali‚Äôs team-mate at San Siro until his ¬£53million summer switch to Tyneside, completely fluffed his lines with only goalkeeper Nick Pope to beat after attempting an audacious flick at the end of a stunning 34th-minute run and only succeeded in tripping himself. Pope will feel he had already earned his slice of good fortune after making five first-half saves in the space of six minutes to pave the way for a 0-0 draw which banked a priceless first point for the Magpies‚Äô Group F account on their return to European football‚Äôs top table after an absence of 20 years. A point at the San Siro in our opening group stage fixture. üëä ‚Äî Newcastle United FC (@NUFC) For the seven-time winners, who were thrashed 5-1 by derby rivals Inter Milan on Saturday, there was no salvation on a night when they created enough chances, but were unable to take any of them, much to the annoyance of the locals among a crowd of 65,695. Pope had to come to Newcastle‚Äôs rescue five times in quick succession after Dan Burn, one of two Geordies in Eddie Howe‚Äôs starting line-up, allowed the ball to run across him, forcing Sven Botman to make a hurried clearance. Midfielder Tommaso Pobega pounced on the loose ball to test the keeper from distance and Pope had to react swiftly to repel Samuel Chukwueze‚Äôs header as the ball was recycled before denying Olivier Giroud from point-blank range with his defenders unable to keep the red and black shirts at bay. Nick Pope. ‚Äî UEFA Champions League (@ChampionsLeague) The England international then tipped away Rade Krunic‚Äôs raking drive and turned Giroud‚Äôs 19th-minute header over the bar after he had been left criminally unmarked from the resulting corner. Ruben Loftus-Cheek blazed over from long range after once again bursting through the black and white cover with Howe‚Äôs men under sustained pressure with Tonali, Bruno Guimaraes and Sean Longstaff struggling to exert any control in midfield. Longstaff was appealing in vain for a 31st-minute penalty after going down under Leao‚Äôs challenge and as Spanish referee Jose Sanchez waved play on, Theo Hernandez broke down the left and crossed for Giroud a the near post, only to see him fire wastefully wide. Leao should have put Milan ahead 11 minutes before the break when he carved his way into the penalty area and past three lunging tackles to go one-on-one with Pope, but inexplicably tried to back-heel the ball home from six yards and simply fell over with Jacob Murphy hacking Pobega‚Äôs follow-up off the line. Murphy mustered the Magpies‚Äô first attempt with a curling 41st-minute shot which flew well wide after Kieran Tripper, Longstaff and Alexander Isak had combined well, but there was a measure of relief when the half-time whistle sounded with the score still at 0-0. Tonali blasted a shot straight at defender Malick Thiaw and Murphy blazed high and wide as Newcastle returned determined to make an impression as an attacking force. Milan‚Äôs build-up play was patient, but the holes which had appeared in the visitors‚Äô defence at regular intervals before the break remained stubbornly closed after it. 62' Double change‚Ä¶ Come on, lads! üí™ [0-0] // ‚Äî Newcastle United FC (@NUFC) Howe made his move with 27 minutes remaining when he sent on Callum Wilson and Miguel Almiron for Anthony Gordon and Murphy, although Pope had to field a stabbed shot from substitute Tijjani Reijnders within seconds. Frustration grew among the Rossoneri ranks with Hernandez chancing his arm from all of 35 yards only for Botman to thump his attempt away, although Tonali was applauded warmly by the home fans when he was replaced by Elliot Anderson with 18 minutes remaining. Leao might have atoned for his first-half blunder when he dived to meet Alessandro Florenzi‚Äôs 74th-minute cross, but he sent his header over Pope‚Äôs crossbar, and a late flurry by Milan was met with stern resistance as the game ended goalless, but only after substitute keeper Marco Sportiello had tipped Longstaff‚Äôs stoppage-time pile-driver over.

newsArray.title: Newcastle hold AC Milan on Champions League return
creator: Guardian Nigeria
newsArray.description: Eddie Howe's Newcastle will be the happier of the two sides to earn a point from the Group F clash at the San Siro after being on the back foot for the vast majority of the match. The post Newcastle hold AC Milan on Champions League return appeared first on The Guardian Nigeria News - Nigeria and World News.
newsArray.content: Newcastle held AC Milan to a goalless draw in Tuesday‚Äôs opening match of their first Champions League campaign in two decades. Eddie Howe‚Äôs Newcastle will be the happier of the two sides to earn a point from the Group F clash at the San Siro after being on the back foot for the vast majority of the match. Milan should have won after wasting a string of chances, particularly in the first half, and dominating the play on Sandro Tonali‚Äôs return to his old stomping ground after being sold to Newcastle in July. Milan sit top of a tough group before Paris Saint-Germain host Borussia Dortmund at the Parc des Princes later on Tuesday, level with their Premier League opposition. Newcastle did little in their first match in Europe‚Äôs top club competition since 2003, the Saudi Arabia-backed team barely creating a chance and lucky to escape with a draw on the balance of play. Tonali‚Äôs father was at the San Siro and saw much more football played by the hosts than by his son, back in the Newcastle starting line-up after missing international duty with injury. The Italy midfielder was loudly cheered by home supporters who don‚Äôt resent his mega-money move to England before kick-off. But home fans, who watched their team be thumped 5-1 by local rivals Inter Milan on Saturday, were left frustrated by their team‚Äôs poor finishing and Newcastle‚Äôs dogged defending which left the match goalless. Follow Us

newsArray.title: Rugby federation appoints UK-trained sports admin board member
creator: Patrick Ahanor
newsArray.description: The Nigeria Rugby Football Federation has appointed a United Kingdom trained sports administrator, Baye Osagie Sylvester, as a coopted member of its board. President of the federation, Dr Ademola Are, endorsed Sylvester‚Äôs appointment on Friday, September 15, 2023; and expressed optimism that the appointee would bring his vast knowledge in Rugby England; and marketing skills to bear. Sylvester, a former Read More
newsArray.content: The Nigeria Rugby Football Federation has appointed a United Kingdom trained sports administrator, Baye Osagie Sylvester, as a coopted member of its board. President of the federation, Dr Ademola Are, endorsed Sylvester‚Äôs appointment on Friday, September 15, 2023; and expressed optimism that the appointee would bring his vast knowledge in Rugby England; and marketing skills to bear. Sylvester, a former Public Relations Officer (PRO), University of Benin Sports, bagged the Rugby honour few days after his appointment as a member of the Nigeria Olympic Committee. The United Kingdom-based Edo State-born Sports Technocrat holds a master degree in International Sports Management in Birmingham City University, England.

newsArray.title: WWE News: Note on Rhea Ripley Onscreen Injury, Baron Corbin‚Äôs ‚ÄòBurn the Ships‚Äô Theme
creator: JeffreyHarris
newsArray.description: More WWE news... The post WWE News: Note on Rhea Ripley Onscreen Injury, Baron Corbin‚Äôs ‚ÄòBurn the Ships‚Äô Theme appeared first on 411MANIA.
newsArray.content: ‚Äì As noted , Rhea Ripley did not appear on last night‚Äôs WWE Raw, as she was selling the attack by Nia Jax that took place last week. It was mentioned during the broadcast that she had injured ribs and not ‚Äúmedically cleared‚Äù to compete. For clarification, PWInsider reports that Ripley‚Äôs injury is merely an angle, and she‚Äôs not legitimately hurt. The report also notes that Rhea Ripley is currently back home in Australia, and she attended an Australia Football League game several days ago with her fianc√©, AEW star Buddy Matthews. ‚Äì Former WWE Champion Big E praised Kofi Kingston following last night‚Äôs Raw. He wrote on X, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm clearly biased but I‚Äôm thankful we still get to watch @TrueKofi deliver incredible performances this deep into his career. Grateful for you, legend, while we still have you in the ring.‚Äù I‚Äôm clearly biased but I‚Äôm thankful we still get to watch @TrueKofi deliver incredible performances this deep into his career. Grateful for you, legend, while we still have you in the ring. ‚Äî Ettore ‚ÄúBig E‚Äù Ewen (@WWEBigE) September 19, 2023 ‚Äì WWE released the ‚ÄúBurn the Ships‚Äù entrance theme song for Baron Corbin:

newsArray.title: Erik ten Hag concerned by Manchester United‚Äôs mounting injury problems
newsArray.description: The Red Devils have lost Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Harry Maguire since the weekend.
newsArray.content: This has been a challenging start to the season for the Old Trafford giants, with off-field issues compounded by a run of three defeats in their last four Premier League matches. United‚Äôs 3-1 meek home loss to Brighton is hardly the best preparation to face Bundesliga champions Bayern Munich on Wednesday, nor are the injury problems that continue to pile up. The Red Devils have lost Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Harry Maguire since the weekend, joining the likes of Raphael Varane, Mason Mount, Luke Shaw and Tyrell Malacia on the sidelines. ‚ÄúYes, of course it‚Äôs a concern,‚Äù Ten Hag said of the spate of injuries that leaves him with a 21-man squad in Germany featuring four goalkeepers. ‚ÄúBut we knew that before and that‚Äôs why we constructed the squad with depth, so we can deal with it, the squad can deal with it.‚Äù Asked whether he can speak to the medical staff about the injury situation, the United boss said: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if we have to go to the doctors or physios because they are dealing with the problems. ‚ÄúFirst of all, injuries always come in top football because we‚Äôre living on the edge. ‚ÄúOf course we analyse why things happen, but we also have to deal with the facts and it‚Äôs always about the players available. Testing out the new ball üëå ‚Äî Manchester United (@ManUtd) ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a strong side we can line up and we have to get the best out of it and we‚Äôre focusing on that. ‚ÄúTo bring up tomorrow again, a good team, make the next step, integrate Rasmus Hojlund, (Sergio) Reguilon), two new players and we are here to get a result.‚Äù Sofyan Amrabat, Kobbie Mainoo and Amad Diallo are others out of the Group A opener through injury, while Donny van de Beek is unavailable having been left out of United‚Äôs Champions League squad. Beyond that, Jadon Sancho remains absent ‚Äúpending resolution of a squad discipline issue‚Äù and Antony has been given a leave of absence following assault allegations against him. ‚ÄúOne thing is true, I think from the start last season I think I almost never started with the best starting XI ‚Äì there was always something like injury,‚Äù Ten Hag said. ‚ÄúBut you have to deal with it and I think we always got the results in apart from the period where we are in now. ‚ÄúThat is football and I have the experience in the past, I managed it in the past. It‚Äôs not always going up and you have to deal with it. ‚ÄúI like these situations because now we have to handle it and we have to manage this. You have to know what to do and that is focusing on the process.‚Äù Ten Hag‚Äôs belief about their path is why he is not getting thrown off kilter by the negativity heading into United‚Äôs first Champions League match in 18 months. ‚ÄúNo, we don‚Äôt feel that we need a reset,‚Äù the former Bayern Munich reserve boss said. ‚ÄúAbsolutely not. ‚ÄúWe are in a process and what you see is that in parts of games we play very good but then also in parts of games we played below our levels. ‚ÄúWhat we have to demand is be consistent, so we have to step up in certain levels all the time for 90-plus minutes. That is the demand on us.‚Äù Wednesday certainly looks a tough ask for United, who will face England captain Harry Kane after he joined Bayern following a summer of speculation. Champions League‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs go! ‚Äî Harry Kane (@HKane) United were strongly linked with the 30-year-old but plumped for promise rather than a proven goalscorer by signing Hojlund, 10 years his junior, from Atalanta. ‚ÄúI think we discussed (Kane and Hojlund during pre-season), so I don‚Äôt think we have to repeat this debate,‚Äù Ten Hag said. ‚ÄúWe are happy with Rasmus. Obviously first games he was injured, he played now Arsenal, he‚Äôs now started. ‚ÄúNow of course we have to integrate him in a team but you can see he‚Äôs a big talent and he will contribute to our game. We are quite confident of that.‚Äù Asked if he had regrets about not signing Kane, Ten Hag simply responded: ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

newsArray.title: Rafael Leao guilty of bad miss as Newcastle earn point in UCL opener at AC Milan
newsArray.description: Keeper Nick Pope had to be at his best to keep the Rossoneri at bay before the break.
newsArray.content: The Portugal international, who was Newcastle star Sandro Tonali‚Äôs team-mate at San Siro until his ¬£53million summer switch to Tyneside, completely fluffed his lines with only goalkeeper Nick Pope to beat after attempting an audacious flick at the end of a stunning 34th-minute run and only succeeded in tripping himself. Pope will feel he had already earned his slice of good fortune after making five first-half saves in the space of six minutes to pave the way for a 0-0 draw which banked a priceless first point for the Magpies‚Äô Group F account on their return to European football‚Äôs top table after an absence of 20 years. A point at the San Siro in our opening group stage fixture. üëä ‚Äî Newcastle United FC (@NUFC) For the seven-time winners, who were thrashed 5-1 by derby rivals Inter Milan on Saturday, there was no salvation on a night when they created enough chances, but were unable to take any of them, much to the annoyance of the locals among a crowd of 65,695. Pope had to come to Newcastle‚Äôs rescue five times in quick succession after Dan Burn, one of two Geordies in Eddie Howe‚Äôs starting line-up, allowed the ball to run across him, forcing Sven Botman to make a hurried clearance. Midfielder Tommaso Pobega pounced on the loose ball to test the keeper from distance and Pope had to react swiftly to repel Samuel Chukwueze‚Äôs header as the ball was recycled before denying Olivier Giroud from point-blank range with his defenders unable to keep the red and black shirts at bay. Nick Pope. ‚Äî UEFA Champions League (@ChampionsLeague) The England international then tipped away Rade Krunic‚Äôs raking drive and turned Giroud‚Äôs 19th-minute header over the bar after he had been left criminally unmarked from the resulting corner. Ruben Loftus-Cheek blazed over from long range after once again bursting through the black and white cover with Howe‚Äôs men under sustained pressure with Tonali, Bruno Guimaraes and Sean Longstaff struggling to exert any control in midfield. Longstaff was appealing in vain for a 31st-minute penalty after going down under Leao‚Äôs challenge and as Spanish referee Jose Sanchez waved play on, Theo Hernandez broke down the left and crossed for Giroud a the near post, only to see him fire wastefully wide. Leao should have put Milan ahead 11 minutes before the break when he carved his way into the penalty area and past three lunging tackles to go one-on-one with Pope, but inexplicably tried to back-heel the ball home from six yards and simply fell over with Jacob Murphy hacking Pobega‚Äôs follow-up off the line. Murphy mustered the Magpies‚Äô first attempt with a curling 41st-minute shot which flew well wide after Kieran Tripper, Longstaff and Alexander Isak had combined well, but there was a measure of relief when the half-time whistle sounded with the score still at 0-0. Tonali blasted a shot straight at defender Malick Thiaw and Murphy blazed high and wide as Newcastle returned determined to make an impression as an attacking force. Milan‚Äôs build-up play was patient, but the holes which had appeared in the visitors‚Äô defence at regular intervals before the break remained stubbornly closed after it. 62' Double change‚Ä¶ Come on, lads! üí™ [0-0] // ‚Äî Newcastle United FC (@NUFC) Howe made his move with 27 minutes remaining when he sent on Callum Wilson and Miguel Almiron for Anthony Gordon and Murphy, although Pope had to field a stabbed shot from substitute Tijjani Reijnders within seconds. Frustration grew among the Rossoneri ranks with Hernandez chancing his arm from all of 35 yards only for Botman to thump his attempt away, although Tonali was applauded warmly by the home fans when he was replaced by Elliot Anderson with 18 minutes remaining. Leao might have atoned for his first-half blunder when he dived to meet Alessandro Florenzi‚Äôs 74th-minute cross, but he sent his header over Pope‚Äôs crossbar, and a late flurry by Milan was met with stern resistance as the game ended goalless, but only after substitute keeper Marco Sportiello had tipped Longstaff‚Äôs stoppage-time pile-driver over.

newsArray.title: Newcastle hold AC Milan on Champions League return
creator: Guardian Nigeria
newsArray.description: Eddie Howe's Newcastle will be the happier of the two sides to earn a point from the Group F clash at the San Siro after being on the back foot for the vast majority of the match. The post Newcastle hold AC Milan on Champions League return appeared first on The Guardian Nigeria News - Nigeria and World News.
newsArray.content: Newcastle held AC Milan to a goalless draw in Tuesday‚Äôs opening match of their first Champions League campaign in two decades. Eddie Howe‚Äôs Newcastle will be the happier of the two sides to earn a point from the Group F clash at the San Siro after being on the back foot for the vast majority of the match. Milan should have won after wasting a string of chances, particularly in the first half, and dominating the play on Sandro Tonali‚Äôs return to his old stomping ground after being sold to Newcastle in July. Milan sit top of a tough group before Paris Saint-Germain host Borussia Dortmund at the Parc des Princes later on Tuesday, level with their Premier League opposition. Newcastle did little in their first match in Europe‚Äôs top club competition since 2003, the Saudi Arabia-backed team barely creating a chance and lucky to escape with a draw on the balance of play. Tonali‚Äôs father was at the San Siro and saw much more football played by the hosts than by his son, back in the Newcastle starting line-up after missing international duty with injury. The Italy midfielder was loudly cheered by home supporters who don‚Äôt resent his mega-money move to England before kick-off. But home fans, who watched their team be thumped 5-1 by local rivals Inter Milan on Saturday, were left frustrated by their team‚Äôs poor finishing and Newcastle‚Äôs dogged defending which left the match goalless. Follow Us

Frustration grew among the Rossoneri ranks with Hernandez chancing his arm from all of 35 yards only for Botman to thump his attempt away, although Tonali was applauded warmly by the home fans when he was replaced by Elliot Anderson with 18 minutes remaining. Leao might have atoned for his first-half blunder when he dived to meet Alessandro Florenzi‚Äôs 74th-minute cross, but he sent his header over Pope‚Äôs crossbar, and a late flurry by Milan was met with stern resistance as the game ended goalless, but only after substitute keeper Marco Sportiello had tipped Longstaff‚Äôs stoppage-time pile-driver over.

newsArray.title: Rugby federation appoints UK-trained sports admin board member
creator: Patrick Ahanor
newsArray.description: The Nigeria Rugby Football Federation has appointed a United Kingdom trained sports administrator, Baye Osagie Sylvester, as a coopted member of its board. President of the federation, Dr Ademola Are, endorsed Sylvester‚Äôs appointment on Friday, September 15, 2023; and expressed optimism that the appointee would bring his vast knowledge in Rugby England; and marketing skills to bear. Sylvester, a former Read More
newsArray.content: The Nigeria Rugby Football Federation has appointed a United Kingdom trained sports administrator, Baye Osagie Sylvester, as a coopted member of its board. President of the federation, Dr Ademola Are, endorsed Sylvester‚Äôs appointment on Friday, September 15, 2023; and expressed optimism that the appointee would bring his vast knowledge in Rugby England; and marketing skills to bear. Sylvester, a former Public Relations Officer (PRO), University of Benin Sports, bagged the Rugby honour few days after his appointment as a member of the Nigeria Olympic Committee. The United Kingdom-based Edo State-born Sports Technocrat holds a master degree in International Sports Management in Birmingham City University, England.

newsArray.title: WWE News: Note on Rhea Ripley Onscreen Injury, Baron Corbin‚Äôs ‚ÄòBurn the Ships‚Äô Theme
creator: JeffreyHarris
newsArray.description: More WWE news... The post WWE News: Note on Rhea Ripley Onscreen Injury, Baron Corbin‚Äôs ‚ÄòBurn the Ships‚Äô Theme appeared first on 411MANIA.
newsArray.content: ‚Äì As noted , Rhea Ripley did not appear on last night‚Äôs WWE Raw, as she was selling the attack by Nia Jax that took place last week. It was mentioned during the broadcast that she had injured ribs and not ‚Äúmedically cleared‚Äù to compete. For clarification, PWInsider reports that Ripley‚Äôs injury is merely an angle, and she‚Äôs not legitimately hurt. The report also notes that Rhea Ripley is currently back home in Australia, and she attended an Australia Football League game several days ago with her fianc√©, AEW star Buddy Matthews. ‚Äì Former WWE Champion Big E praised Kofi Kingston following last night‚Äôs Raw. He wrote on X, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm clearly biased but I‚Äôm thankful we still get to watch @TrueKofi deliver incredible performances this deep into his career. Grateful for you, legend, while we still have you in the ring.‚Äù I‚Äôm clearly biased but I‚Äôm thankful we still get to watch @TrueKofi deliver incredible performances this deep into his career. Grateful for you, legend, while we still have you in the ring. ‚Äî Ettore ‚ÄúBig E‚Äù Ewen (@WWEBigE) September 19, 2023 ‚Äì WWE released the ‚ÄúBurn the Ships‚Äù entrance theme song for Baron Corbin:

newsArray.title: Erik ten Hag concerned by Manchester United‚Äôs mounting injury problems
newsArray.description: The Red Devils have lost Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Harry Maguire since the weekend.
newsArray.content: This has been a challenging start to the season for the Old Trafford giants, with off-field issues compounded by a run of three defeats in their last four Premier League matches. United‚Äôs 3-1 meek home loss to Brighton is hardly the best preparation to face Bundesliga champions Bayern Munich on Wednesday, nor are the injury problems that continue to pile up. The Red Devils have lost Aaron Wan-Bissaka and Harry Maguire since the weekend, joining the likes of Raphael Varane, Mason Mount, Luke Shaw and Tyrell Malacia on the sidelines. ‚ÄúYes, of course it‚Äôs a concern,‚Äù Ten Hag said of the spate of injuries that leaves him with a 21-man squad in Germany featuring four goalkeepers. ‚ÄúBut we knew that before and that‚Äôs why we constructed the squad with depth, so we can deal with it, the squad can deal with it.‚Äù Asked whether he can speak to the medical staff about the injury situation, the United boss said: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if we have to go to the doctors or physios because they are dealing with the problems. ‚ÄúFirst of all, injuries always come in top football because we‚Äôre living on the edge. ‚ÄúOf course we analyse why things happen, but we also have to deal with the facts and it‚Äôs always about the players available. Testing out the new ball üëå ‚Äî Manchester United (@ManUtd) ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a strong side we can line up and we have to get the best out of it and we‚Äôre focusing on that. ‚ÄúTo bring up tomorrow again, a good team, make the next step, integrate Rasmus Hojlund, (Sergio) Reguilon), two new players and we are here to get a result.‚Äù Sofyan Amrabat, Kobbie Mainoo and Amad Diallo are others out of the Group A opener through injury, while Donny van de Beek is unavailable having been left out of United‚Äôs Champions League squad. Beyond that, Jadon Sancho remains absent ‚Äúpending resolution of a squad discipline issue‚Äù and Antony has been given a leave of absence following assault allegations against him. ‚ÄúOne thing is true, I think from the start last season I think I almost never started with the best starting XI ‚Äì there was always something like injury,‚Äù Ten Hag said. ‚ÄúBut you have to deal with it and I think we always got the results in apart from the period where we are in now. ‚ÄúThat is football and I have the experience in the past, I managed it in the past. It‚Äôs not always going up and you have to deal with it. ‚ÄúI like these situations because now we have to handle it and we have to manage this. You have to know what to do and that is focusing on the process.‚Äù Ten Hag‚Äôs belief about their path is why he is not getting thrown off kilter by the negativity heading into United‚Äôs first Champions League match in 18 months. ‚ÄúNo, we don‚Äôt feel that we need a reset,‚Äù the former Bayern Munich reserve boss said. ‚ÄúAbsolutely not. ‚ÄúWe are in a process and what you see is that in parts of games we play very good but then also in parts of games we played below our levels. ‚ÄúWhat we have to demand is be consistent, so we have to step up in certain levels all the time for 90-plus minutes. That is the demand on us.‚Äù Wednesday certainly looks a tough ask for United, who will face England captain Harry Kane after he joined Bayern following a summer of speculation. Champions League‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs go! ‚Äî Harry Kane (@HKane) United were strongly linked with the 30-year-old but plumped for promise rather than a proven goalscorer by signing Hojlund, 10 years his junior, from Atalanta. ‚ÄúI think we discussed (Kane and Hojlund during pre-season), so I don‚Äôt think we have to repeat this debate,‚Äù Ten Hag said. ‚ÄúWe are happy with Rasmus. Obviously first games he was injured, he played now Arsenal, he‚Äôs now started. ‚ÄúNow of course we have to integrate him in a team but you can see he‚Äôs a big talent and he will contribute to our game. We are quite confident of that.‚Äù Asked if he had regrets about not signing Kane, Ten Hag simply responded: ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

Milan‚Äôs build-up play was patient, but the holes which had appeared in the visitors‚Äô defence at regular intervals before the break remained stubbornly closed after it. 62' Double change‚Ä¶ Come on, lads! üí™ [0-0] // ‚Äî Newcastle United FC (@NUFC) Howe made his move with 27 minutes remaining when he sent on Callum Wilson and Miguel Almiron for Anthony Gordon and Murphy, although Pope had to field a stabbed shot from substitute Tijjani Reijnders within seconds. Frustration grew among the Rossoneri ranks with Hernandez chancing his arm from all of 35 yards only for Botman to thump his attempt away, although Tonali was applauded warmly by the home fans when he was replaced by Elliot Anderson with 18 minutes remaining. Leao might have atoned for his first-half blunder when he dived to meet Alessandro Florenzi‚Äôs 74th-minute cross, but he sent his header over Pope‚Äôs crossbar, and a late flurry by Milan was met with stern resistance as the game ended goalless, but only after substitute keeper Marco Sportiello had tipped Longstaff‚Äôs stoppage-time pile-driver over.

newsArray.content: The Nigeria Rugby Football Federation has appointed a United Kingdom trained sports administrator, Baye Osagie Sylvester, as a coopted member of its board. President of the federation, Dr Ademola Are, endorsed Sylvester‚Äôs appointment on Friday, September 15, 2023; and expressed optimism that the appointee would bring his vast knowledge in Rugby England; and marketing skills to bear. Sylvester, a former Public Relations Officer (PRO), University of Benin Sports, bagged the Rugby honour few days after his appointment as a member of the Nigeria Olympic Committee. The United Kingdom-based Edo State-born Sports Technocrat holds a master degree in International Sports Management in Birmingham City University, England.

newsArray.content: ‚Äì As noted , Rhea Ripley did not appear on last night‚Äôs WWE Raw, as she was selling the attack by Nia Jax that took place last week. It was mentioned during the broadcast that she had injured ribs and not ‚Äúmedically cleared‚Äù to compete. For clarification, PWInsider reports that Ripley‚Äôs injury is merely an angle, and she‚Äôs not legitimately hurt. The report also notes that Rhea Ripley is currently back home in Australia, and she attended an Australia Football League game several days ago with her fianc√©, AEW star Buddy Matthews. ‚Äì Former WWE Champion Big E praised Kofi Kingston following last night‚Äôs Raw. He wrote on X, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm clearly biased but I‚Äôm thankful we still get to watch @TrueKofi deliver incredible performances this deep into his career. Grateful for you, legend, while we still have you in the ring.‚Äù I‚Äôm clearly biased but I‚Äôm thankful we still get to watch @TrueKofi deliver incredible performances this deep into his career. Grateful for you, legend, while we still have you in the ring. ‚Äî Ettore ‚ÄúBig E‚Äù Ewen (@WWEBigE) September 19, 2023 ‚Äì WWE released the ‚ÄúBurn the Ships‚Äù entrance theme song for Baron Corbin:
